text: Madagascar at the Olympics is a history which starts in the 1960s. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for Madagascar was MAG. "Official abbreviations" at The Games of the XVIII Olympiad, Tokyo, 1964, [p. 9 of 409 PDF]; retrieved 2012-10-12. It is now MAD."Abbreviations, National Olympic Committees," 2009 Annual Report, p. 90 [PDF p. 91 of 94]; retrieved 2012-10-12. ==History== Madagascar was first at the Olympic Games in 1964. They have been to every game since except for 1976 and 1988. They have never won a medal. 2006 was the first time at the Winter Olympics. ==Olympic Medal Table (Summer)== Games Athletes Athletes by sport Athletes by sport Athletes by sport Athletes by sport Athletes by sport Athletes by sport Athletes by sport Medals Medals Medals Games Athletes Tokyo 1964 1 1 - - - - - 0 0 0 Mexico City 1968 4 3 1 - - - - 0 0 0 1972 Munich 3 3 - - - - - 0 0 0 1976 Montreal did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete Moscow 1980 6 3 2 1 - - - 0 0 0 1984 Los Angeles 2 2 - - - - - 0 0 0 Seoul 1988 did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete Barcelona 1992 9 3 - 2 2 2 - 0 0 0 Atlanta 1996 2 1 - 1 - - - 0 0 0 Sydney 2000 10 7 - 3 - - - 0 0 0 Athens 2004 9 3 - 2 1 2 1 0 0 0 Beijing 2008 6 2 - 1 - 2 1 0 0 0 ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes ==References== == Other websites == * Madagascar profile at London2012.com Category:Madagascar Category:Nations at the Olympics
